trans-unit.source: Represents the base class of all classes using COM+ services.
Under certain conditions, a class that is derived from ServicedComponent that runs in a COM+ application may stop responding.
This problem is caused by an Activity deadlock.
Activities can deadlock on multithreaded applications because of an asynchronous cleanup of component references.
To work around this problem, call the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent.Dispose%2A> method when you complete work with objects derived from ServicedComponent.
For more information, see [http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?scid=kb;en-us;327443](http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?scid=kb;en-us;327443).
> [!NOTE] > Client code must call `Dispose` on serviced components to ensure proper operation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent"></xref> class.
This constructor is called by derived class constructors to initialize state in this type.
Called by the infrastructure when the object is created or allocated from a pool.
Override this method to add custom initialization code to objects.
This method is called by the infrastructure before the object is put back into the pool.
Override this method to vote on whether the object is put back into the pool.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the serviced component can be pooled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Called by the infrastructure just after the constructor is called, passing in the constructor string.
Override this method to make use of the construction string value.
The construction string.
Called by the infrastructure when the object is about to be deactivated.
Override this method to add custom finalization code to objects when just-in-time (JIT) compiled code or object pooling is used.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent"></xref>.
Finalizes the object and removes the associated COM+ context.
It is recommended to explicitly release COM+ objects and external resources before the garbage collector frees the object.
If the external resource is scarce or expensive, better performance can be achieved by explicitly releasing COM+ resources when they are no longer needed.
Explicit control is provided by the Dispose method.
Calling Dispose allows the resources used by the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> to be reallocated for other purposes.
For more information about Dispose, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose` method of each referenced object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to release both managed and unmanaged resources; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to release only unmanaged resources.
Finalizes the object and removes the associated COM+ reference.
It is preferable to use the `Dispose` design pattern rather than DisposeObject.
The object to dispose.

Ensures that, in the COM+ context, the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent"></xref> class object's <xref uid="langword_csharp_done" name="done" href=""></xref> bit is set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> after a remote method invocation.

The <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.IRemoteDispatch.RemoteDispatchAutoDone%2A> method does not belong to the published interface of the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> class and does not need to be implemented elsewhere.
To be added.
A string converted from a response object that implements the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMethodReturnMessage"></xref> interface.

Does not ensure that, in the COM+ context, the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent"></xref> class object's <xref uid="langword_csharp_done" name="done" href=""></xref> bit is set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> after a remote method invocation.

The <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.IRemoteDispatch.RemoteDispatchNotAutoDone%2A> method does not belong to the published interface of the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> class and does not need to be implemented elsewhere.
A string to be converted into a request object that implements the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessage"></xref> interface.
A string converted from a response object that implements the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMethodReturnMessage"></xref> interface.
Obtains certain information about the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent"></xref> class instance.

The [IServicedComponentInfo.GetComponentInfo(Int32, String\[\])](assetId:///M:System.EnterpriseServices.IServicedComponentInfo.GetComponentInfo(System.Int32@,System.String[]@)?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True) method does not belong to the published interface of the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> class and does not need to be implemented elsewhere.
A bitmask where 0x00000001 is a key for the serviced component's process ID, 0x00000002 is a key for the application domain ID, and 0x00000004 is a key for the serviced component's remote URI.
